content: Your {{productName}} account is successfully disabled. The {{productName}} owner or admin can permanently delete your disabled account.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message indicating that an account has been successfully disabled. It appears in a confirmation dialog after attempting to delete a profile and contains the product name for contextualization.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "حذف حسابك المعطل نهائيًا" (delete your disabled account permanently) is somewhat awkward in Arabic. A more natural phrasing would be 'يمكنهم حذف حسابك المعطل بشكل دائم' or 'يمكنهم حذف حسابك المعطل للأبد'.
The use of the product name variable '{{productName}}' is consistent with the English, but ensure the Arabic text handles the variable correctly within the product's implementation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed, but verify correct variable handling in the product implementation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Finnish translation uses a hyphen between '{{productName}}' and '–'. While not technically incorrect, it's less common and less polished in Finnish, especially for user-facing text. A space would be more typical.
The Armenian translation uses 'ադմինիստրատորը' for 'admin'. While technically correct, the more common and easily understood term in Armenian is 'ադմին'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ձեր {{productName}} հաշիվը հաջողությամբ անջատված է: {{productName}} սեփականատերը կամ ադմին կարող են ընդմիշտ ջնջել ձեր անջատված հաշիվը:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation maintains the double curly braces `{{productName}}` which are not standard in Japanese text. It should be replaced with the actual product name or removed if not necessary.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace `{{productName}}` with the actual product name or remove the curly braces if the variable isn't being dynamically inserted.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ລົບບັນຊີ" (lop banchy) translates to "to delete an account" but sounds unnatural in Lao in this context. A more natural phrasing would be something like "ລົບຖິ້ມບັນຊີ" (lop thim banchy) or "ລົບອອກຈາກລະບົບ" (lop ok jak rabop).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ບັນຊີທີ່ຖືກປິດການໃຊ້ງານຂອງທ່ານສາມາດຖືກລົບຖິ້ມອອກຈາກລະບົບຢ່າງຖາວອນໂດຍເຈົ້າຂອງຫຼືຜູ້ບໍລິຫານ {{productName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation lacks the same formatting consistency as the English version regarding spacing around the variable {{productName}}. Consider adding spaces for better readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ບັນຊີ {{ productName }} ຂອງທ່ານຖືກປິດການໃຊ້ງານຢ່າງສໍາເລັດແລ້ວ ໂດຍເຈົ້າຂອງຫຼືຜູ້ບໍລິຫານ {{ productName }} ສາມາດລົບບັນຊີທີ່ຖືກປິດການໃຊ້ງານຂອງທ່ານໄດ້ຢ່າງຖາວອນ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English term 'disabled' is translated as 'gedeactiveerd'. While 'gedeactiveerd' is close in meaning, 'disabled' implies a state of being unable to use, which 'gedeactiveerd' doesn't fully capture in this context. 'Verwijderd' or 'uitgeschakeld' might be more accurate, depending on the intended nuance.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Uw {{productName}} account is met succes verwijderd.' or 'Uw {{productName}} account is met succes uitgeschakeld.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ඔබගේ {{productName}} ගිණුම සාර්ථකව අබල කර ඇත' could be improved to better convey the meaning of 'Your {{productName}} account is successfully disabled.'  'අබල කර ඇත' (abala kara ath) implies abandonment or termination, but 'disabled' has a slightly different nuance. A more accurate translation might focus on the account being rendered inactive.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබගේ {{productName}} ගිණුම සාර්ථකව අවහිර කර ඇත.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ඔබගේ අබල කළ ගිණුම ස්ථිරවම මකා දැමිය හැක' is a bit clunky.  While technically correct, it can be simplified for better readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබගේ අබල කළ ගිණුම ස්ථිරවම මකා දැමීමට {{productName}} හිමිකරු හෝ පරිපාලකයාට හැකියාව ඇත.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'konto' is less common than 'účet' when referring to an online account in Slovak. While 'konto' isn't strictly incorrect, 'účet' is the preferred and more natural term.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Váš účet {{productName}} bol úspešne deaktivovaný. Vlastník alebo administrátor {{productName}} môže natrvalo vymazať vaše deaktivované účet.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation uses the word 'налог' (nalog) which translates to 'account' or 'log' but in this context 'account' is the correct term. 'налог' is more frequently associated with an online login or a banking account. The English uses 'account' consistently, and the translation should follow suit.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ваш {{productName}} рачун је успешно онемогућен. {{productName}} власник или администратор може трајно обрисати ваш онемогућен рачун.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian word 'налог' is used instead of 'рачун' which is the proper translation of 'account' in the context of a digital account.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ваш {{productName}} рачун је успешно онемогућен. {{productName}} власник или администратор може трајно обрисати ваш онемогућен рачун.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "disabled" is translated as "devre dışı bırakıldı". While accurate, "pasif hale getirildi" might be a more natural and common phrasing in Turkish for 'disabled' in the context of an account.

The variable {{productName}} is used consistently in both the English and Turkish versions.  It's important to ensure this variable is correctly implemented and replaced with the appropriate product name.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure {{productName}} variable is properly handled during implementation.
